intro: Cotoneaster taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan cotoneaster, is a deciduous shrub native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its attractive, bright red berries that appear in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters and features opposite, elliptical leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
